block.p: A NEW WORLD: England's First View of America, by Kim Sloan. (University of North Carolina, cloth, $60; paper, $29.95.) In 1585 the British artist John White accompanied a group of colonists to the North Carolina coast with instructions to ''drawe to liefe all strange birdes, beastes, fishes, plantes.'' The resulting images, collected here, are like a slide show of the wonders they found: flying fish, colorful butterflies and a variety of Native American tribes. White probably saw the flamingo when he passed through the Bahamas or the West Indies.

A NEW WORLD: England's First View of America, by Kim Sloan. (University of North Carolina, cloth, $60; paper, $29.95.) In 1585 the British artist John White accompanied a group of colonists to the North Carolina coast with instructions to ''drawe to liefe all strange birdes, beastes, fishes, plantes.'' The resulting images, collected here, are like a slide show of the wonders they found: flying fish, colorful butterflies and a variety of Native American tribes. White probably saw the flamingo when he passed through the Bahamas or the West Indies.
